intro: Pedicularis nanchuanensis, commonly known as the Nanchuan lousewort, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the genus Pedicularis, which is part of the Orobanchaceae family, known for its hemiparasitic nature. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. It features showy, often reddish or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
